code_value: Scientists have long known that in the reaction to stress, a new important role is played by certain elements released by the body. The UCLA research team suggests that the female tend-and-befriend response is also based on an element. This element has been studied in the context of childbirth, but now it is being studied for its role in the response of both men and women to stress. The principal investigator, Dr. Taylor, explained that "animals and people with high levels of this element are more relaxed, more social, and less anxious. While men also generate this element, its effects are reduced by another element".
